Lack enough support: The claim lacks support as there is no evidence or valid reasoning provided to support the assertion that Georgia shouldn't have been allowed to compete in the Olympics.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Georgia was allowed to compete in the Olympics, as confirmed by the article.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Alabama should have been allowed to compete in the Olympics based on the belief that its athletes are among the most talented and passionate, without providing any evidence to support this assumption.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the importance of the issue by stating that it was unfair for Georgia to be allowed to participate as an independent entity.
